channel.title: Anyone Interested
channel.description: So, if anyone has been paying attention, I am not that great with programming. So, while I was in the shower, I thought of an amazing idea (great shower ideas), which is to get a couple of people together, get to know each other, and Work on projects either together, or refer to each other for ideas and help. Like I said, I am pretty bad, at the moment, with programming, so anyone can join. From new comers (like me), to advanced programmers. This isn't a development team or anything like that. Just trying to get some people together to learn and advance my knowledge in java or any language. Add me on Skype: Devinhdl

item.title: Anyone Interested
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Oziaz:

Yea, that’s true, but I don’t want to bug everyone on here from posting too much and being too ‘needy’ lol

As long as you don’t highlight a thousand people you should be fine

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone Interested
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I don’t really know why everyone’s acting like that, in #mopar if you make an attempt to learn beforehand and ask good, well structured questions and don’t ask things that you can simply google the answers of then you won’t be trolled and will be helped. If you don’t act like an idiot they won’t treat you like one. It’s simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone Interested
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Yeah asking #mopar is not a good idea unless we know you.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone Interested
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:7, topic:537037”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=655852.msg4389914#msg4389914 date=1387092222]

Hang out in the mopar irc. You’ll have all kinds of people around to discuss ideas with or get help from

i hope you are not serious about sending him to #mopar.
[/quote]
I was thinking #moparscape. Flame_ said #mopar[/quote]

I believe Flame_ is not necessarily wrong, as from time to time (albeit not very often) the #mopar channel regulars actually do help new people who come. However, new people to #moparscape are typically trolled as well (by people like me, unfortunately). I believe a better learning strategy is to read a good book (or whatever resource is best suited for the learner’s learning style) and then ask intelligent questions, preferably on a freenode language channel because there is probably a greater chance that the individual’s question will not only be answered, but also explained well. There are also channels like ##programming where people do the sort of thing that the OP stated in his post. The community environment is evidently different, but it may be a fine idea and approach.

Read full topic
